law.catch_line: A corporation may file a certificate of notice for record with the Department....

text.section: A corporation may file a certificate of notice for record with the Department.

A certificate of notice may not:
Amend, supplement, or correct the charter of the corporation in any manner; or
Affect any rights or liabilities of stockholders, whether or not accrued or incurred before the certificate of notice is filed.
A certificate of notice is not a part of the charter of a corporation.
A director of a corporation is not required to authorize or direct the filing of a certificate of notice.

A corporation is not required to file a certificate of notice for any purpose, including to indicate that there has been a change to the facts or information contained in a previously filed certificate of notice.
A certificate of notice shall be executed in the manner required for charter documents by § 1-301 of this title.
